summary.p: The DataContext class represents something like a scope in which queries and expressions are evaluated.

section.title: Sharing
section.p: The DataContext can be shared across multiple different queries and expressions.

section.title: Link to Metadata Context
section.p: Each DataContext is linked to a MetadataContext, which provides needed meta information, e.g. how to compare certain types or what properties and methods a type has.

section.title: Elements in a Data Context
section.p: A DataContext may contain different items. The following table lists all of them.

tr.td: An aggregate is a function that can be used in a query to perform aggregations. See Custom Aggregates for details how create new functions.

A constant is named value whose value cannot change. In contrast to Parameters this means that you cannot change its value. If want to change a constant you have to remove it from the data context an re-create it with a different value. The upside is that constants can be used to optimize queries and expressions by the compiler.
A function is used to perform calculations inside of queries and expressions. See Custom Functions for details how to create new functions.
A table is data source from which a query can select data. See Custom Tables for details how to create new tables.
A table relation declares a relationship between two tables. This is useful for features like Code Assistance.
